meanings.sent1: The holdback on the gate kept the dog from running away.
meanings.sent2: The holdback of the chain prevented the door from swinging open.
meanings.sent3: The holdback on the cookie jar stopped the kids from sneaking treats.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure acted as a holdback to pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The holdback of the leash made sure the puppy stayed close by.

meanings.definition: An amount of money withheld or retained.
meanings.sent1: The contractor received a holdback of payment until the project was completed.
meanings.sent2: The holdback in the contract ensured quality workmanship.
meanings.sent3: The holdback in the budget caused some delays in the project.
meanings.sent4: The holdback of funds affected the company's cash flow.
meanings.sent5: The holdback of the bonus motivated employees to work harder.

meanings.sent1: She had to holdback her tears during the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: It is important to holdback your anger in difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: He tried to holdback his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The dam holds back the water from flooding the town.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to holdback the students from leaving the classroom early.

meanings.sent1: The traffic jam will holdback our arrival at the party.
meanings.sent2: Don't let fear holdback you from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather might holdback the outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: His injury didn't holdback his determination to finish the race.
meanings.sent5: The technical issue shouldn't holdback the project progress.
